dt: {bc}the surrender of an alleged criminal usually under the provisions of a treaty or statute by one authority (such as a state) to another having jurisdiction to try the charge

et: French, from {it}ex-{/it} + Latin {it}tradition-, traditio{/it} act of handing over {ma}{mat|treason|}{/ma}
shortdef: the surrender of an alleged criminal usually under the provisions of a treaty or statute by one authority (such as a state) to another having jurisdiction to try the charge
